dialogue: I don’t want to hear that nonsense. Somebody down there pushing them people in their wells.
What was you and Lymon doing over in Stoner County?
Berniece, what’s the matter? You alright? What’s the matter?
That’s alright. Take your time. You alright. What’s the matter?
Sutter...Sutter’s standing up in the hall.
Hey, Boy Willie?
Go on, Berniece.
Just standing there with a blue suit on.

I told the nigger he left out of here with that sack of money, we thought we might never see him again. Boy Willie say he wasn’t gonna see him till he got broke. I looked up and seen him sitting on the doorstep asking for two dollars. Look at him laughing. He know it’s the truth.
Boy Willie, I didn’t see that truck out there. I thought you was out selling watermelons.
Come on, Berniece...let it go, it ain’t his fault.
He ain’t here, is he? Is he?
Mama’s here, baby. What happened?
I thought you took that suit to the pawn shop?
Come on in, Avery, and have a seat. Don’t pay neither one of them no mind. They been arguing all day.
Here, set this comb back over there on that stove. Don’t pay Boy Willie no mind. He been around here bothering me since I come home from work.
I ain’t said nothing about getting married. I said I was thinking about it.
Avery get him his church you all can make it nice. Berniece said you was coming by to bless the house.
That’s what I been trying to tell them. Seem like one of them ought to respect the other one’s wishes.
I wish Boy Willie would go on and leave my house. That’s what I wish. Now, he can respect that. ‘Cause he’s leaving one way or another.
Maretha, get on out the way. Get her out the way, Doaker.
Go on, do what your mama told you.
Wining Boy, sit down somewhere. You been out there drinking all day. Come in here smelling like an old polecat.
You know Berniece don’t like all that drinking.
Avery, go on and bless the house.
You need to bless that piano. That’s what you need to bless. It ain’t done nothing but cause trouble. If you gonna bless anything go on and bless that.
